definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: The L. A. Lakers were the best team in the VERY tight Western Conference this season.
sentences.chinese: 湖人队是这个赛季西部豪强纷争中最优秀的一支球队。

definition: lit. strong soldiers and sturdy horses (idiom)/fig. a well-trained and powerful army
land-owning class, esp. during Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties 魏晉南北朝|魏晋南北朝
New Armies (modernized Qing armies, trained and equipped according to Western standards, founded after Japan's victory in the First Sino-Japanese War in 1895)

feudal vassal/feudal princes, esp. the monarchs (dukes or princes) of the several vassal states 諸侯國|诸侯国 of Zhou during Western Zhou and Spring and Autumn periods 11th-5th century BC/subordinate warlord/local official
outstanding heroes/warlords vying for supremacy (in former times)/stars (of sports or pop music)
great family/rich family/large landlord/conspicuous spender or consumer
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
